Title: Why did World War II erupt?
Article:
Axis Powers
Germany, Italy, Japan

Allied Powers
France, Britain, Soviet Union, China, USA

World War Il lasted from 1939 to 1945, It was a total war that involved 61 countries, with 1.7 billion people. After World War I ended in 1918, Germany had to give up land, and was banned from having armed forces. In 1933, the German people voted for a leader named Adolf Hitler, who led a political party in Germany called the National Socialists, or Nazis, Hitler promised to make his country great again, and quickly began to arm Germany once more, and to seize land from other countries.
On Friday 1st September, 1939, German forces stormed the Polish frontier. When Hitler refused to withdraw from Poland, Britain and France declared war on Germany.
So, World War Il began in Europe on 3rd September 1939. Soon, it became a global war, involving most of the world's nations, who were divided into opposing military alliances the Allies and the Axis. It was the most widespread and deadliest war in history.
In 1945, the war ended in a victory for the Allies. The Soviet Union and USA subsequently emerged as the world's superpowers.
